Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the potential income tax revenue from basketball events alone, as it states that it is estimated to be "probably over $600 million over the life of the lease." This estimate may be inflated or overly optimistic.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the estimated income tax revenue. It only refers to two documents without providing further details or analysis.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the income tax revenue from basketball events alone will be the main source of revenue contributing to the estimated $600 million over the life of the lease. This assumption may not take into account other revenue sources or factors that could impact the actual revenue generated.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that could affect the estimated income tax revenue. It solely focuses on the basketball events without considering other economic or financial factors that could influence the revenue.
Understate: The claim does not appear to understate any information or facts.
